projects.title: Molecular, Physiological, and Microbial Interaction Mechanisms in Mangroves and Their Role in Climate Change Resilience
projects.description: This project investigates the molecular and physiological adaptations of Avicennia germinans and Rhizophora mangle to salinity stress under climate change scenarios. By integrating transcriptomics, metagenomics, and environmental measurements, we assess their resilience and pathogen susceptibility. The findings will provide scientific foundations for mangrove conservation and sustainable management in Mexico.

projects.title: Genome sequencing of wild and commercial papaya
projects.description: This project aims to identify defense-related genes in papaya (Carica papaya) by analyzing the genomic differences between wild and commercial varieties to understand the genetic changes during domestication.

projects.title: Transcriptome and metagenome analysis in commercial and wild vanilla
projects.description: By studying transcriptomes and metagenomes, this project explores the genetic and functional diversity of vanilla, comparing commercial and wild varieties to identify key genes associated with adaptation and cultivation.

projects.title: Gene regulation in response to stress in Chlamydomonas reinhardtii
projects.description: Using bioinformatics tools, this project studies gene regulation of the green microalga Chlamydomonas reinhardtii under various stress conditions. The goal is to understand and optimize lipid production for biotechnological applications. This project was carried out in collaboration with the Scientific Research Center of Yucatan.

projects.title: Transcriptomics of Ciricote tree floral development
projects.description: This project investigates the molecular basis of floral development in ciricote by comparing the long-styled and short-styled morphs. Using RNA-seq and bioinformatic analyses, it identifies genes and regulatory pathways associated with heterostyly. The findings will advance understanding of the genetic mechanisms underlying floral differentiation and reproductive strategy in this species.

projects.title: Cenote Metagenomics and Biosynthetic Gene Cluster Discovery
projects.description: This project explores the microbial diversity of cenotes through metagenomic sequencing and bioinformatic analysis. It focuses on the identification of biosynthetic gene clusters (BGCs) linked to secondary metabolite production with biotechnological potential. The findings will provide insights into the metabolic functionality of these ecosystems and their potential applications in biotechnology.
